abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Saint
            Lucia - Water Supply Infrastructure Improvement Project is
            to alleviate the urgent need to improve the availability of
            good quality drinking water in the northern section of the
            island. Current inadequacies of the distribution system
            coupled with the demands for growth in the region are
            placing increasing pressure on the distribution system. This
            environmental assessment (EA) presents environmental impacts
            expected : potential soil erosion; interdiction of public
            roadways; contamination of work sites with fuels and
            hazardous materials; pollution from construction wastes;
            noise from construction activities; dust control issues;
            cultural historical sites; standing water and disease vector
            production. Some of the mitigation measures are :
            development plans for : site stabilization and erosion
            control; traffic management; construction waste management;
            oil and hazardous materials management; and workers
            sanitation plan. For dust control wet roads with water;
            prohibit long-term accumulation of standing water suitable
            for mosquito reproduction; identify lands where crops will
            be removed for construction and negotiate with farmer and
            pay appropriate compensation; and finally. Dispose of fuels
            and used containers in accordance with St. Lucia's law
